page.title: 05SHEEP AND LAMBS IN SKERRIES
page.content:
Looking after sheep and lambs involves a lot of work.Around April and May the sheep start lambing.This is a very busy time of year.Twice or more each day you have to go round the hills looking to see if the sheep have had any lambs.All the sheep are{marked}and every household has a different one for their own sheep. If you find any lambs and they are not your own you have to report it to the owners. This goes on for about a month.
A little while later the sheep have to be{dipped}to stop them getting diseases and the lambs have to be taken away from their mothers. The sheep have to be{sheared}sometime during the summer.
There is a{fence}dividing the land and the ram is kept on one side of it.
